reviews.text: Stopped here overnight from the Grand Canyon & Page. Friendly staff, big rooms and comfy beds. We were on the ground floor, and a bit uneasy. Our deadbolt was broken, the screw was out like someone broke into it, so it wouldn't work. 2 tv's. The one in the living room didn't work great, the volume would not go very loud, and with the loud air conditioner, it was too hard to hear the TV. Continental breakfast included rubbery eggs, a nice change from standard small continental breakfasts! Free computer and printer in the upstairs lobby. The front desk staff were helpful and nice. so many hotels to choose from, would try someplace else next time, but this would due if that is all that is available.
reviews.title: clean, quiet, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for a place close enough to the Grand Canyon and not too far from Phoenix. This was perfect. Arrived late at night after a long drive from Vegas and the person at the desk was very friendly and efficient. The room was clean and comfortable. Several restaurants in the general area not to mention the free continental breakfast. Would stay there again
reviews.title: Friendly and clean

likes.liked: — Great location, right off major highways

reviews.text: This hotel is just like any other standard Hampton Inn. Stayed for two nights early July '07.
reviews.title: Good hotel, could be better.

reviews.text: Dislikes: Long wait times for elevator - that we got a room on the fifth floor did not alleviate any hardships :-(
reviews.title: Overpriced and average

reviews.text: The air-conditioner started emitting a burning electric coil odor all of a sudden around 3AM on the second night:-(
reviews.title: Great Stop in Flag

reviews.text: I've always liked Hampton Inns, and used them almost exclusively when I traveled for work. I was still surprised how large and nice the suites were when I arrived at this property. Prior to this visit, I had only stayed in the regular HI hotel rooms. I had four children with me, and there was enough room for everyone to be comfortable, with room to spare. The kitchen can be a plus, and could save some money for larger groups wanting to eat some meals in.
reviews.title: Great family/large group hotel

likes.liked: — Large rooms, indoor pool, full-size kitchen

reviews.text: For kids, the indoor pool (and jacuzzi) will be a winner.
reviews.title: Great!
Enjoyed
reviews.text: The property is located pretty conviently so that you can walk to several restaurants, and with kids, the fact the Wal-Mart was very close was handy for purchasing a few needed items.

reviews.title: Flagstaff - 2 nights
reviews.text: I arrived in the early afternoon, which was ahead of the rush, so I had no waiting at check-in. I did notice from about 5-8pm, the front desk was really slammed. If you can time your arrival to not be during the rush, you will be okay. But, if you do show up during the busy times, your check-in may be the one part of the stay you dislike. It's too bad they haven't integrated the self check-in kiosks used by sister properties Embassy Suites.

reviews.title: Delightful Stay
reviews.text: The large suites will be a nice experience for larger groups. Also calculate in savings in food between the kitchen and free breakfast buffet.

We stayed at the Hampton Inn and Suites Flagstaff for 3 nights during Spring Break. We had a suite with a separate bedroom and a pull out couch in the lounge which gave us the room we needed for 4 adults and 2 small children. The room was well furnished, the beds comfortable, and even the sofa sleeper was OK. The kids (6 and 8 yrs old) loved the indoor pool which was just the right depth for them (max of 5 feet). The complimentary breakfast was great and there was plenty of variety and quantities despite the number of people there each day. Staff were also friendly and helpful. No train noise as has been mentioned of other Flagstaff hotels. Super Walmart, a grocery store and plenty of eateries within walking distance. Overall I recommend this hotel for family stays.
reviews.title: A good hotel for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got the jacuzzi room on the 5th floor (top floor). The room was pretty big, clean and nice, big bathroom. There was some cracked paint in the bathroom above the shower, but that's not a big deal. The "warm" breakfast includes eggs that were microwave cooked, so they're kind of like rubbery discs, but hey, it's included. Check-in and out was very easy and they also let us check in an hour early. Overall, a nice stay.
reviews.title: Decent for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our recent trip to Northern AZ we stayed at the Hampton Inn & suites twice (10/3 to 10/5 & 10/11 to 10/14) we had a 2 queen suite and king suite w/ fireplace both were laid out exactly the same. The king suite was showing a bit of wear but nothing major. We were missing a remote to the TV and informed the front desk and with in a few minutes we had a new one. The free breakfast the Hampton provides is pretty good, the hot choices change daily and the area is large and can hold a good sized crowd. As others have mentioned, the parking area is small and if you arrive late you may have to park over by the Chevron station or by the Sizzler. My wife and I noticed that the area has grown in the past four years since we were last there, traffic is quite heavy during morning & evening commutes. There are two computers on the 3rd floor mezzanine that guests can access the internet, etc. which was nice. There is a pool, hot tub, fitness room and laundry on the first floor which is more like a daylight basement.
reviews.title: Nice stay

likes.disliked: — Area traffic and lack of ample parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All-and-all out experience at the hampton was very good and would probably stay there again when in Flagstaff.
reviews.title: Poorest Service Ever

reviews.text: Being Hilton Honors Gold Club members, we had booked a room with a king size bed & non-smoking, When we arrived, we were told our room was not longer available. Instead of being upgraded as a Gold club member, we were downgraded to a room with two small b eds, that had a door that could barely be opened, had the main electrical outlet in the bathroom loose in the wall & cracked and the toilet plugged & overflowed upon first use. The staff could care less ablout any of these issues other than to say "we're full...what do you want us to do?" They staff promised a gift basket which we never received.
reviews.title: So-so Stay

likes.liked: — Comfortable beds, spacious room, Hampton Inn breakfast
